body: @mpkorstanje, we would appreciate your feedback on this proposal.

#### Update

I spiked an implementation of the proposal in the following feature branch.

https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/compare/main...sbrannen:junit-framework:issues/4885-commons.io.Resource

Currently `Resource` is in active use by Cucumber. 

From a technical point of view, this is indeed a small and manageable change but will create a barrier where both JUnit and Cucumber will have to be upgraded at the same time. In the past, when Spring was involved, this resulted in some friction:

* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/3044
* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/3027
* https://github.com/orgs/cucumber/discussions/2262

So I would prefer a non-breaking upgrade path, but I'm not sure if one exists.

Cucumber depends on both consumers and producers of `Resource` through:

```java
    private static final EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver<CucumberEngineDescriptor> resolver = EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver
            .<CucumberEngineDescriptor> builder()
            .addSelectorResolver(context -> new FileContainerSelectorResolver(FeatureIdentifier::isFeature))
            .addResourceContainerSelectorResolver(resource -> isFeature(resource.getName()))
...
```

and:

```java
    @Override
    public Resolution resolve(ClasspathResourceSelector selector, Context context) {
        Set<Resource> resources = selector.getClasspathResources();
...
```

And I think the proposed step no. 4 would break the `addResourceContainerSelectorResolver` but I can't say that for certain without actually trying that out.
Jinx! I'll try the feature branch.

issue.title: Relocate `MediaType` to `jupiter.api` package and deprecate existing class

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

As can be seen in https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/4876#issuecomment-3233342829, `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType` causes cycles between the `api` and `api.extension` packages in `junit-jupiter-api`.

Since the `junit-jupiter-api` artifact constitutes the public API for JUnit Jupiter, we have traditionally not allowed package cycles within that artifact.

Thus, in order to reduce package cycles and improve the quality of the code base, we should _relocate_ `MediaType` to the `org.junit.jupiter.api` package and deprecate the existing class.

Specifically, I am proposing the following.

1. Introduce `org.junit.jupiter.api.MediaType` as a copy of `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType`.
2. Declare `org.junit.jupiter.api.MediaType` as a sealed type permitting only `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType` as a subtype.
3. Have `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType` extend `org.junit.jupiter.api.MediaType`.
4. Deprecate `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType` for removal.
5. Update all APIs that reference `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType` to reference `org.junit.jupiter.api.MediaType` instead.

Since `org.junit.jupiter.api.MediaType` is a _relatively_ new API, we assume that it is not actively used by many projects yet. In light of that, we are considering deprecating the current APIs for JUnit 6.0.

However, we hope that affected users will only need to change their imports from `org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.MediaType` to `org.junit.jupiter.api.MediaType` to address any issues.

## Related Issues

- #4876
- #4885

body:
Remarks so far:

1. As expected, the proposed change breaks `addResourceContainerSelectorResolver` with a `ClassCastException`.

```
java.lang.ClassCastException: class org.junit.platform.commons.io.DefaultResource cannot be cast to class org.junit.platform.commons.support.Resource (org.junit.platform.commons.io.DefaultResource and org.junit.platform.commons.support.Resource are in unnamed module of loader 'app')
	at java.base/java.util.function.Predicate.lambda$and$0(Predicate.java:69)
	at org.junit.platform.commons.support.scanning.DefaultClasspathScanner.processResourceFileSafely(DefaultClasspathScanner.java:218)
	at org.junit.platform.commons.support.scanning.DefaultClasspathScanner.lambda$findResourcesForUri$0(DefaultClasspathScanner.java:165)
...
```

Unfortunately, this exception is swallowed because `DefaultClasspathScanner.logGenericFileProcessingException` logs it at debug level only. When using the Suite engine this results in a failure without any details:

```
org.junit.platform.suite.engine.NoTestsDiscoveredException: Suite [io.cucumber.skeleton.RunCucumberTest] did not discover any tests
...
```

Because it is not immediately obvious that the dependencies are misalinged, I think this will result in quite a support headache.


2. As proposed `org.junit.platform.commons.support.Resource` may as be removed immediately. I don't see a good reason to deprecate it for removal first. 

But I'm going to try having `org.junit.platform.commons.io.Resource` extend  `org.junit.platform.commons.support.Resource` instead and see if that results in a more graceful upgrade path.

I think there is a graceful upgrade path:

Step 1: JUnit deprecates `org.junit.platform.commons.support.Resource` in v6.

* https://github.com/mpkorstanje/junit5/commit/93ddec4455889638122c4984e27471fb07fceb94

Step 2: Cucumber migrates to `org.junit.platform.commons.io.Resource` after Spring upgrades to JUnit 6
* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/commit/b3eca8962d2bb6f730f69fb89bdd5a72a0606406

Step 3: JUnit removes `org.junit.platform.commons.support.Resource` in v7.
* https://github.com/mpkorstanje/junit5/commit/a48829d84ab564aa2e7f9bc5a14937779193f2a8

Note: Individual migration steps need polishing. Did just enough for a proof of concept.

Would that be acceptable?

one by one.

issue.title: Relocate `Resource` to `org.junit.platform.commons.io` package

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
This PR introduces a new `Resource` interface in the new `org.junit.platform.commons.io` package.

The old interface extends the new one so it can be used in places that now consume the new interface.

The resource finding/scanning methods in `ReflectionSupport` are now deprecated in favor of the new ones in the `ResourceSupport` class.

Since `Predicate<...io.Resource>` and `Predicate<...support.Resource>` have the same erasure, this PR introduces `ResourceFilter` (mimicking the existing `ClassFilter`) in order to be able to overload methods such as `EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver.Builder.addResourceContainerSelectorResolver`. 

Resolves #4885.

<!-- Please describe your changes here and list any open questions you might have. -->

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---
